meanings.definition: A sound made by liquid moving quickly
meanings.sent1: The sloosh of the waterfall was loud and soothing.
meanings.sent2: I heard a sloosh as the water rushed down the drain.
meanings.sent3: The sloosh of the fountain made me want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The sloosh of the waves against the shore was like nature's music.
meanings.sent5: The sloosh of the rain hitting the roof was calming.

meanings.definition: To splash or move with a splashing sound
meanings.sent1: The kids slooshed in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent2: She slooshed the mop across the floor to clean up the spill.
meanings.sent3: The dog slooshed around in the mud and got all dirty.
meanings.sent4: The paint slooshed out of the can when she opened it too quickly.
meanings.sent5: He slooshed the water in the bucket as he tried to wash the car.

meanings.definition: A mixture of water and mud
meanings.sent1: The sloosh in the swamp made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, there was a sloosh of mud in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The sloosh on the path looked like chocolate pudding.
meanings.sent4: The sloosh in the riverbank was perfect for making mud pies.
meanings.sent5: She accidentally stepped in a sloosh and got her shoes dirty.

meanings.definition: To clean or rinse with water
meanings.sent1: She slooshed the dishes before putting them in the dishwasher.
meanings.sent2: He slooshed his face with cold water to wake up in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The car wash slooshed the vehicle with soapy water.
meanings.sent4: She slooshed the windows with a squeegee to make them sparkle.
meanings.sent5: He slooshed the garden vegetables to remove the dirt before cooking.

meanings.definition: A loose, flowing garment worn by women in ancient Greece
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful sloosh that fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The dancers twirled in their colorful slooshes during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The costume designer created a modern version of the ancient sloosh.
meanings.sent4: The sloosh draped elegantly over her shoulders, enhancing her beauty.
meanings.sent5: The sloosh added a touch of grace to her outfit as she walked.
